title: International Women's Day 2021: History, marches and celebrations
description: Everything you need to know about worldwide celebrations taking place on 8 March.

title: Mercedes unveil Lewis Hamilton's 2021 Formula 1 car
description: Mercedes reveal Lewis Hamilton's car for the 2021 season that retains the team's black anti-racism livery for a second season.

title: Edward Colston statue: Four deny damage to statue
description: The four have appeared in court after Edward Colston's statue was torn down in Bristol.

title: Covid-19: Regular tests a 'game-changer' for schools, says science adviser
description: Rapid tests will give confidence that schools can open safely, a government science adviser says.

title: Budget 2021: Furlough set to be extended - Kwasi Kwarteng
description: Kwasi Kwarteng says help for firms and workers will continue, as Chancellor Rishi Sunak prepares to unveil the Budget.

title: Last of Us 2 leads Bafta Games Awards nominations
description: With 13 nominations, the action-adventure horror game has the most nominations in history.

title: Authorities investigate video of man climbing on to dead horse
description: A video of a dead horse being climbed on at a gallops is under investigation by horseracing authorities.

title: Nigeria school abduction: Hundreds of girls released by gunmen
description: A group of nearly 300 girls are released after they were abducted from their school last week.

title: England opener Beaumont tops ODI batting rankings
description: England opener Tammy Beaumont becomes the leading one-day batter in the world for the first time.

title: Angelina Jolie sells Winston Churchill painting for record £7m
description: The Tower Of The Koutoubia Mosque, owned by the actress, is sold to an unidentified buyer.

title: Scottish government lawyers had 'reservations' about Salmond case
description: Concerns were raised about the legal battle more than two months before the government conceded the case.

title: Energy firms overcharged one million switching customers
description: Households were overcharged by a total of £7.2m when they should have been protected from price rises.

title: Fulham midfielder Kevin McDonald to have kidney transplant
description: Fulham midfielder Kevin McDonald says he has chronic kidney disease and is due to have a transplant next month.

title: Liverpool legend Ian St John dies aged 82
description: Former Liverpool and Scotland forward Ian St John has died at the age of 82.

title: Migrating flamingos turn Mumbai lakes into 'sea of pink'
description: Thousands of flamingos migrate to western India every year in search for food and nesting grounds.

title: Budget 2021: Five things to look out for from Rishi Sunak
description: Tax rises and an extension of Covid support are both tipped to be announced in this week’s Budget.

title: Ant Middleton axed by C4 over 'personal conduct'
description: The broadcaster confirms he won't be taking part in future series of SAS: Who Dares Wins.

title: World Cup 2030: UK and Republic of Ireland associations back UK government support for bid
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson says it is the "right time" to bid to host the 2030 World Cup and the plan is backed by football associations across the UK and the Republic of Ireland.

title: Human origins: 'Little Foot' fossil's big journey out of Africa
description: How the priceless skull of an ancient ancestor was brought to the UK from South Africa for study.

title: Is Fernandes' replacement at Sporting Lisbon Portugal's next superstar?
description: Sporting Lisbon appear to have struck gold with a former Wolves youngster who has a better scoring record than Bruno Fernandes.

title: Covid-19: Can more mayors heal the 'North-South divide'?
description: Local leaders are pushing for more devolution, as England eases out of lockdown.

title: The Papers: Digital travel passes and 'prayers for Philip'
description: Plans for a vaccine passport to boost travel and fears over Prince Philip's health are among the front-page stories.

title: How rape allegations have rocked Australian politics
description: A political adviser's accusation has prompted other women to come forward with their own allegations.

title: Fortnite: From piano player to pro gamer - aged just eight
description: Joseph Deen tells the BBC about his ambitions after signing with a professional esports team.

title: Documenting emperor penguins in Antarctica
description: Stefan Christmann spent almost 15 months in Antarctica alongside 10,000 emperor penguins.

title: Syria war: 'This is the price we had to pay for freedom'
description: Syrian civilians describe the devastating impact 10 years of war has had on them.

title: Dozens of arts freelancers lose out on Covid support over tax 'error'
description: Dozens of arts freelancers miss out on Covid support because of errors with their pay, Equity says.

title: Palestinian 'Techno Queen' Sama' Abdulhadi faces court over shrine event
description: DJ Sama' Abdulhadi is facing a court hearing following a music event near a West Bank holy site.

title: Back to school with a little bear and his hearing aids
description: How a picture book about a little bear who discovers he is deaf tells a personal story for its creators.

title: Aston Martin: The billionaire building 'a British Ferrari'
description: Lawrence Stroll, executive chairman of Aston Martin, tells the BBC he wants to build a firm with a "luxury profile".
